name: Adjacent Reach Condition for Recruitment (hardened/embedded)
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for movement of water, sediment, and organisms support recolonization, maintain species diversity, and enable recovery after disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown: Longitudinal connectivity and aquatic organism passage; barriers can limit recolonization, migration, and gene flow.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel and Watershed

Method: Desktop (barrier inventory/imagery) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown: Inventory potential barriers (culverts, dams, grade controls) within the specified upstream/downstream distance using barrier datasets and imagery; confirm passability where feasible. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Adjacent Reach Condition for Recruitment (hardened/embedded)
inputs.type: desktop (barrier inventory/imagery) with field verification where feasible
inputs.helpMarkdown:
Imagery & 
Site data
Barrier inventories (state/federal/NGO), NHD/NHDPlus hydrography, recent imagery, and field verification where feasible.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Channel immediately upstream or downstream of project reach (i.e., within 1 km or 0.62 mi) has native bed and bank material. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Channel immediately upstream or downstream of project reach (i.e., within 1 km or 0.62 mi) has native bed and bank material that is highly embedded by fine sediment. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Channel immediately upstream or downstream of project reach (i.e., within 1 km or 0.62 mi) has native bed and bank material that is highly embedded by fine sediment. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Channel immediately upstream or downstream of project reach (i.e., within 1 km or 0.62 mi) is concrete, piped, or hardened. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)
